                      ITS Accounts & Access Management                                                             search the site                                                                        IT Service Desk      1-212-998-3333     24 hours, 7 days a week      AskITS@nyu.edu      www.nyu.edu/servicelink          In-Person Help      10 Astor Place, 4th Floor     9:00am-6:00pm, Mon-Fri          Global Locations     See www.nyu.edu/its/servicedesk/     for local Service Desk information.          related pages           ITS Request & Account Forms                    ITS provides computer account-related support for the NYU community. Individuals  interested in the use of specialized ITS computing resources  must first apply for accounts and/or access privileges. Special account requests may require  sponsorship or a departmental signature. (Note, however, that access to   NYUHome is available to most members  of the NYU community without having to apply for an account. For information  on how to activate your NYU NetID and access NYUHome, see   http://www.nyu.edu/its/netid/ .   To learn more about the accounts available to you, or to apply for one, select your NYU  affiliation above, or browse the ITS Request & Accounts Forms page.    If you have an accounts-related question, search the ServiceLink knowledge base or contact the IT Service Desk (see sidebar).    User Responsibilities   All users of NYU's computing and networking resources have responsibilities of which  they need to be aware.    Page last reviewed: October 3, 2014

account-related support for the NYU community. Individuals  interested in the use of specialized ITS computing resources  must first apply for accounts and/or access privileges. Special account requests may require  sponsorship or a departmental signature. (Note, however, that access to   NYUHome is available to most members  of the NYU community without having to apply for an account. For information  on how to activate your NYU NetID and access NYUHome, see   http://www.nyu.edu/its/netid/ .   To learn more about the accounts available to you, or to apply for one, select your NYU  affiliation above, or browse the ITS Request & Accounts Forms page.    If you have an accounts-related question, search the ServiceLink knowledge base or contact the IT Service Desk (see sidebar).    User Responsibilities   All users of NYU's computing and networking resources have responsibilities of which  they need to be aware.    Page last reviewed: October 3, 2014

                     Locations & Facilities                                                                         Home           //        Help & Support                 //        Ask ITS                 //         IT Service Desk                                      IT Service Desk                                                 search the site                                                                        IT Service Desk   24 hours a day, 7 days a week     In NYC: 1-212-998-3333  AskITS@nyu.edu   Contact form   ServiceLink         In-person help in NYC   10 Astor Place, 4th Floor  9:00am-6:00pm, Mon-Fri       Global locations  See the "How to get help" section to the left for local Service Desk information.          related pages            NYURoam Wireless       NYU Classes       NYU Google Apps (Email, Calendar & more)       NYU ResNet       NYU Print Service       NYUHome Help       ITS Training & Workshops       IT Service Status                     The IT Service Desk is the first point of contact for technology services and help from Information Technology Services; see below for contact details.   For self-service support and request forms for services provided by ITS and an ever-expanding number of other NYU-provided services, explore NYU ServiceLink .       New York, Accra, Madrid & Tel Aviv   NYU community members in New York, Accra, Madrid, and  Tel Aviv can contact the IT Service Desk in a number of ways:    For help by telephone , call 1-212-998-3333 to speak with IT Service Desk staff 24 hours a day, seven days a week. (NYU-NY community members can simply call 8-3333 from on-campus phones.)    For help online , submit your question (including as many details as possible) using the contact form or by sending email to AskITS@nyu.edu . A representative will respond to the email address you supply within one business day.    For in-person help in New York , visit the IT Service Desk at 10 Astor Place, 4th floor, from Monday through Friday, 9am to 6pm ET. For help with configuring your laptop computer, however, call 1-212-998-3333 first to make an appointment.     Abu Dhabi   NYU community members at NYU Abu Dhabi can contact the IT Service Desk 24 hours a day, seven days a week by sending email to nyuad.it.help@nyu.edu or by calling 971-2-628-8888 (or simply 8-8888 from on-campus phones).   NYU Abu Dhabi Campus Technology Center walk-in hours on the 3rd floor of the Library are: Sunday-Thursday, 8am-7pm GST; Friday: closed; Saturday: 12pm-7pm GST.   Berlin   NYU community members at NYU Berlin can contact the IT Service Desk by sending email to AskITS@nyu.edu or by calling 49-30-290291-333 (or simply 333 from on-campus phones).   Buenos Aires   NYU community members at NYU Buenos Aires can contact the IT Service Desk by sending email to AskITS@nyu.edu or by calling 4828-5233 (or simply 833 from on-campus phones).   Florence   NYU community members at NYU Florence can contact the IT Service Desk by sending email to AskITS@nyu.edu or by calling 39-055-5007-777 (or simply 0-7777 from on-campus phones).   London   NYU community members at NYU London can contact the IT Service Desk by sending email to nyul.it.help@nyu.edu or by calling 44-20-79073-333 (or simply 333 from on-campus phones). NYU London IT Service Desk hours are Monday through Thursday, 8am to midnight GMT; Friday, 1pm to midnight GMT; and Saturday & Sunday, 5pm to midnight GMT.   Paris   NYU community members at NYU Paris can contact the IT Service Desk by sending email to AskITS@nyu.edu or by calling 01-53-73-28-33 (or 3-2833 from on-campus phones).   Prague   NYU community members at NYU Prague can contact the IT Service Desk by sending email to AskITS@nyu.edu or by calling 224-240-882.   Shanghai   NYU community members at NYU Shanghai can contact the IT Service Desk by sending email to shanghai.it.help@nyu.edu or by calling 9-5555 (from on-campus phones) or 86-21-20595555 (from off-campus phones).   Singapore   NYU community members at Tisch Asia (Singapore) can contact the IT Service Desk by sending email to AskITS@nyu.edu or by calling 800-181-1101 (or simply 333 from on-campus phones).   Sydney   NYU community members at NYU Sydney can contact the IT Service Desk by sending email to AskITS@nyu.edu or by calling 61-2-8016-8233 (or 6-8233 from on-campus phones).   Washington, DC   NYU community members at NYU Washington, DC can contact the IT Service Desk by sending email to AskITS@nyu.edu or by calling 202-654-8333 (or 504-8333 from on-campus phones).    For NYU telephone, voice mail, and telecommunications support, please visit the   Telephones & Voice Mail page.    Faculty looking for technical support with academic projects should contact the   Digital Studio .    Page last reviewed: January 27, 2015

Wagner Graduate School of Public Service      School of Continuing and Professional Studies      School of Law      School of Medicine      Silver School of Social Work      Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development      Tisch School of the Arts                                                        go                                                    New York University              New York University              Information Technology Services                                                 About ITS                              Get Connected                               Communicate & Collaborate                               Help & Support                                 Computer Security                               Instruction & Research                                Locations & Facilities                             Advanced Media Studio                            Assistive Technologies                          Computer Labs                           Data Services                             Digital Studio                           NYU Global Sites                             Hands-on Computer Classrooms                          IT Service Desk                          Map of ITS Locations                        NYU Print Service                                                                                     Home           //        Locations & Facilities                 //         NYU's Global Sites                                            NYU's Global Sites                     search the site                                                                        related pages                Your NetID & Password       Connect at NYU's Global Sites                        NYU's International Academic and Research Centers offer many of the same information technology  services that are available on NYU's Washington Square campus. Although services vary somewhat  by location (see below), they generally include NYUHome, student computing labs, staff and  faculty desktop computing, Internet access, NYU Libraries research services, NYU Classes course  support, and telephone services. Bobst Library resources are available at all sites for study abroad students,  faculty, and staff through the NYU Libraries website .    Site-specific service information is available for each of the following:     NYU Abu Dhabi   NYU Shanghai   NYU in Accra, Ghana NYU in Buenos Aires, Argentina   NYU in Florence, Italy   NYU in London, England   NYU in Madrid, Spain   NYU in Paris, France   NYU in Prague, Czech Republic   NYU in Washington, DC   Tisch Asia, Singapore      More Information About NYU     For information about connecting and using your computer at one of NYU's international sites, please  visit Connect at NYU's Global Sites .     For information about studying abroad, please visit the Study Abroad website at   www.nyu.edu/studyabroad .    For general information about NYU's Office of Global Programs , please visit the Office of Global Programs website  at www.nyu.edu/global.html .       If you have been accepted into an NYU study abroad program :      You will need an active NYU NetID. To activate your NetID online, go to http://start.nyu.edu .    For advice and information about preparing to go abroad, find the "Admitted Students" page for your program at www.nyu.edu/studyabroad .         If you need technical support while at one of the NYU Global Sites, either speak with your program's student life office or send a detailed email, including your current location, to AskITS@nyu.edu .       International Sites Facilities and Services    NYU Abu Dhabi   Information about technology services and support for faculty, staff, and researchers is available through the NYUAD Intranet. Matriculated students can access information about technology services and support through the Student Portal.    Students: https://students.nyuad.nyu.edu/services/technology-and-support/   Faculty and staff: https://intranet.nyuad.nyu.edu/administrative-services/technology-and-support/     For general information on NYU Abu Dhabi, please visit nyuad.nyu.edu .    NYU Shanghai   For information about NYU Shanghai, visit: http://www.nyu.edu/global/global-academic-centers/shanghai .     NYU Accra    NYU Accra offers computing resources to students in several ways:    Students are invited to use their own laptops for use at the NYU in Ghana Academic Center. Internet access and printing  are available via wireless (if you have your own wireless card or Airport) or wired data jacks (by plugging in with an Ethernet cable).   Note : Due to space restrictions, students may not bring larger "desktop" computers (with separate monitor and CPU), even if they are  equipped for wireless access.   Students can use one of several Apple computers in the computer lab at the Academic Center. These computers are equipped with access to  the Internet, printers, and the Microsoft Office suite of programs (Word, Office, Excel, and Access).    All NYU in Ghana residence halls offer wireless Internet access.       For additional information about these and other services available at NYU Accra, visit   www.nyu.edu/global/global-academic-centers/accra .    NYU in Buenos Aires    Instructional Environment     Student labs are equipped with Macintosh desktop computers.   Classrooms are equipped with teaching computers and projectors.      Communications     Internet access is available for students, faculty, and staff.   Email: Faculty, staff, and students can use NYUHome or a personal web-based email account.      Services     Wireless Internet access is available at the Academic Center.   Desktop services are supported by on-site IT staff.      For more information about these and other services available at NYU in Buenos Aires, visit: www.nyu.edu/global/global-academic-centers/buenos-aires .     NYU in Florence    Instructional Environment     Student labs are equipped with Windows and Macintosh desktop computers.   Student labs are open 7 days a week, at varying hours.   Students are allowed to bring their own laptops and self-register for campus and residence hall use.   The two on-site residence halls, Villa Colletta and Villa Natalia, are equipped with Internet ports for student use in each room.      Communications     Internet access is available for students, faculty, and staff.   Email: Faculty, staff, and students can use NYUHome or a personal web-based email account.   Video conferencing is available for faculty and staff use.   Telephones are available in every room of the two on-site residence halls, Villa Colletta and Villa Natalia.   Faculty and staff are able to place long distance calls on all NYU phones in both New York and Florence  using their NYU telephone authorization codes.      Services     NYURoam Wireless network access is available at a variety of locations  at NYU in Florence. To use this service, follow the normal NYURoam Wireless instructions on this site.  The one exception is for people using a VPN client. For details, look for the red note for Florence residents in the VPN  instructions within the Configuration section of the NYURoam Wireless website .   Desktop services are supported by on-site IT staff.   Network services are supported by ITS.   Telecommunications services are supported by ITS.      For more information about these and other services available at NYU in Florence, visit:   www.nyu.edu/global/global-academic-centers/florence .      NYU in London   Instructional Environment     Student labs are equipped with Windows and Macintosh desktop computers.   Student labs are open 6 days a week (closed Sundays).   Students are allowed to bring their own laptops and self-register for campus use.   Students are allowed to sign out loaner laptops in the Center.   Special software is provided for Business and Pre-Med courses.       Communications     Internet access is available for students, faculty, and staff.      Video conferencing is available at the Academic Center.      Services     NYURoam Wireless network access is available at NYU in London. To use this service, follow the NYURoam wireless configuration instructions . However, if you use a VPN client, look for the red note for London residents in the VPN instructions in the Configuration section of the NYURoam wireless configuration website.   Desktop services support is provided by on-site IT support staff.   Network services are provided by ITS.   Telecommunications services are provided by ITS.      For more information about these and other services available at NYU in London, visit www.nyu.edu/global/global-academic-centers/london .       NYU in Madrid   Instructional Environment     Student labs are equipped with 25 desktop computers.   Student labs are open Monday - Friday (and on Saturdays during exam periods).      Communications     Internet access is available for students, faculty, and staff.      Services     Wireless network access is now available at the academic center. There are approximately  15 wireless cards available for loan from student services (deposit required), or students can  configure their own wireless cards when they arrive. Contact student services for more information.   Student, faculty, and staff computing support is provided by a local IT support firm.   Network services are supported by a local outsource firm.   Telecommunications services are supported by a local provider.      For more information about these and other services available at NYU in Madrid, visit   www.nyu.edu/global/global-academic-centers/madrid .        NYU in Paris   Instructional Environment     Student labs are equipped with 15 desktop computers (located in the garden-level library) with full word processing and Internet capabilities.   Student labs are open Monday - Friday (and on Saturdays during exam periods).      Communications     Internet access is available for students, faculty, and staff.   Videoconferencing is available at the Academic Center.      Services     Wireless network access is available at the academic center. Instructions on how to access the wireless network will be provided to you during orientation.   If you need residential Internet access, we provide you with information about reliable  Paris-based Internet providers in the "Living in Paris" guide you will receive during orientation.   Student, faculty, and staff computing support is provided by a local support firm.   Network services are supported by a local IT support firm.   Telecommunications services are supported by a local provider.       For more information about these and other services available at NYU in Paris, visit   www.nyu.edu/global/global-academic-centers/paris .        NYU in Prague   Instructional Environment     Student labs are equipped with Windows computers.   Student labs are open 6 days a week (closed Sundays).   Students are allowed to bring their own laptops and register for campus use.   Students are allowed to use loaned laptops while in the Center.   Special software is provided for Business and Pre-Med courses.   Software configuration on lab desktop computers parallels NYU/ITS Student Technology Services.      Communications     Internet access is available for students, faculty, and staff.   Videoconferencing equipment is available at the Center.      Services     Desktop services are supported by a local provider.   Network services are supported by NYU IT and a local provider.   Telecommunications services are supported by a local provider.      For more information about these and other services available at NYU in Prague, visit   www.nyu.edu/global/global-academic-centers/prague .        NYU in Washington, DC   Instructional Environment     Student labs are equipped with 15 desktop computers and 2 printers served by the NYU Print Service .   Student labs are open 24x7.      Communications     Internet access is available for students, faculty, and staff.   Guest NYURoam wireless access is available for guests for events.      Services     Student, faculty, and staff computing support is provided by an external IT Support Provider as needed.   Network services are supported by NYU IT in New York.   Telecommunications services are supported by NYU IT in New York.      For more information about these and other services available at NYU in Washington, DC, visit   www.nyu.edu/global/global-academic-centers/washington-dc .
